Row.Text: Why, you… you… worthless get of a barren mule! I will crush you!
You ungrateful whelp! I will teach you to attack your betters!
You evil wretch. I should have destroyed you years ago.
Your greed and ineptness leaves me little choice: prepare for war!
Your people cry out for relief from your incompetence. Prepare for war!
Your continued existence is an embarrassment to world leaders everywhere. You must be destroyed.
You fool! Do you know what you have done? The world will long lament your heinous crime!
Curse you! The blood of the greatest leader in world history is on your hands!
You have defeated me?? But how could this have happened? There must be some mistake!
Normally, I'd simply send my armies into your territory and take what I want, but I'm feeling especially merciful today. I hope that you will take advantage of this once-in-a-lifetime offer.
Could you possibly spare this, friend? Persia would be in your debt for a thousand-thousand years!
A gift? For me? How thoughtful!
I Darius, ruler of mighty Persia, do greet you with warmth and friendship. Do feel free to consult me if you become overwhelmed with the responsibilities of leadership.
I graciously greet you, and generously offer you my hand in friendship. I am Darius, leader of Persia and an extremely wise and remarkable man.
Welcome, Stranger! I am Darius, the faultless leader of mighty Persia. But of course you knew that.
We'll call it a tie, shall we?
I am sure that your meant no offense, but your offer was highly insulting to me personally. Please improve it.
You must do better than that.
My dear friend, I am afraid that your offer is a little on the stingy side. Can you not improve it?
Is that the best you can do?
It is clear that you don't fully understand the intricacies of foreign trade. But let me assure you that your offer is insufficient. Please improve it.
Can you do a little better?
We must sadly decline your offer. Perhaps we can discuss this again in a few years - say, after your civilization has discovered soap.
I am most regretfully unable to agree to your terms. If you were a great world leader you would understand.
I am afraid that I cannot accept your offer. But do come back when you have something worth trading.
Did you come up with this idea yourself? How remarkable.
It is as if you are reading my mind! How clever you are!
Excellent idea! I was about to propose it myself!
We are taught to be generous to our inferiors. I therefore make you this offer.
I will pauperize myself with my extreme generosity! I urge you to accept this offer before I regain my senses!
In my endless magnanimity, I am making you this unbelievably fair offer. You agree, of course?
I think you misunderstand the situation: I am the great Darius, king of Persia, and you are a worthless cur, unfit to kiss the hem of my garment.
Hah! A fine jest, indeed! You were joking, were you not?
Why not? I doubt that you'll know what to do with it anyway.
Certainly! Anything! My palace? My treasury? The blood from my very heart? Ask and you shall receive!
Why, of course! Persian charity is justifiably legendary!
You are playing a dangerous game.
Very well. The next time I shall not be so polite!
Indeed? I trust that you will not live to regret your short-sightedness.
And that's how a successful military campaign should be run. I hope you were taking notes.
